summary: The "Closing the Meal Gap Act of 2025" amends the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008. It mandates the use of a "low-cost food plan" to calculate Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits, replacing the current "thrifty food plan." The bill defines the low-cost plan, outlining its composition and requiring periodic reevaluation by the Secretary. Furthermore, it adjusts income deductions, including a standard medical expense deduction, and eliminates existing time limits on SNAP eligibility, along with related conforming amendments to various sections of the Food and Nutrition Act. The bill emphasizes adjustments for different household sizes and geographic areas.
